ScissorPlot¶

class components.liftingsurfaces.scissorplot.ScissorPlot(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

This script will generate a scissor plot to size the horizontal tail (HT). The required inputs are: the CG position, aerodynamic center position, the tail arm, the HT aspect ratio, HT span efficiency, the tail to main wing speed ratio, the wing pitching moment about the aerodynamic center, the wing lift slope, the c_l for controllability (derived in wing), and the allowable shift in center of gravity.

Returns:

Required Tail Surface Area and Scissor Plot
Parameters:
  • x_cg (float) – The CG positon in SI meters.
  • x_ac (float) – The aerodynamic center positon in SI meters.
  • x_lemac (float) – The distance to the leading edge of the Mean Aerodynamic center in SI meters.
  • mac (float) – This is the MAC length.
  • AR (float) – This is the aspect ratio of the aircraft.
  • e (float) – This is the oswald efficiency factor of the aircraft.
  • CD0 (float) – This is the zero-lift drag coefficient of the aircraft.
  • k_factor (float) – This is the k factor to correct the canard main wing’s C_L alpha due to canard downwash.
  • SM (float) – This is the required stability margin.
  • AR_h (float) – This is the assumed aspect ratio of the horizontal tail.
  • e_h (float) – This is the oswald efficiency factor of the HT.
  • VhV_conv (float) – This is the speed ratio for a conventional tail aircraft.
  • VhV_canard (float) – This is the speed ratio for a canard aircraft.
  • a_0 (float) – This is the lift slope for a thin airfoil.
  • Cl_w (float) – This is the controllability lift coefficient of the wing at 1.2*V_s imported from wing.
  • C_mac (float) – This is the pitching moment about the aerodynamic center of the wing. This is calculated with AVL in ‘wing.py’
  • Cla_w (float) – This is the lift curve slope of the wing. This is calculated with AVL in ‘wing.py’.
  • delta_xcg (float) – This is the assumed change in the cg location.
  • configuration (float) – This is a switch to determine the configuration.
  • lhc (float) – Derived input of the non-dimensionalized tail arm based on configuration choice
AR¶

Below is the wing aspect ratio.

AR_h¶

Below is the HT aspect ratio.

CD0¶

Below is the assumed zero lift drag coefficient

C_mac¶

Below is the pitching moment about the aerodynamic center of the wing. This is calculated with AVL in ‘wing.py’.

Cl_w¶

Below is the controllability lift coefficient of the wing at 1.2*V_s imported from wing.

Cla_w¶

Below is the lift curve slope of the wing. This is calculated with AVL in ‘wing.py’.

SM¶

Below is the assumed Stability Margin.

VhV_canard = 1.0¶

Below is the speed ratio for a canard aircraft.

VhV_conv = 0.9219544457292888¶

Below is the speed ratio for a conventional tail aircraft.

a_0 = 6.283185307179586¶

Below is the lift slope for a thin airfoil.

cl_h[source]¶

This attribute returns the lift coefficient of the tail for the controllability case. The canard is assumed to be all moving.

Returns:HT lift coefficient
Return type:float
cla_h[source]¶

This attribute estimates the lift slope of a low sweep, low speed three dimensional wing.

Returns:HT lift curve slope
Return type:float
cla_w_canard[source]¶

This attribute reduces the wing lift slope for the canard case. It is reducing the C_l alpha from AVL.

Returns:Canard main wing lift slope
Return type:float
configuration¶

Below is a switch to determine the configuration.

delta_xcg¶

Below is the assumed change in the cg location.

downwash_a[source]¶

This attribute estimates the wings change in downwash with angle of attack.

Returns:Downwash gradient of main wing
Return type:float
e¶

Below is the wing span efficiency factor

e_h¶

Below is the assumed HT span efficiency factor.

k_factor¶

Below is the k factor to correct the canard main wing C_Lalpha due to canard downwash.

lhc[source]¶

Derived input of the non-dimensionalized tail arm based on configuration choice

Returns:Non-dimensional tail arm
Return type:float
mac¶

Below is the MAC length

plot_scissordiagram[source]¶

This attribute will plot the scissor plot.

Returns:Scissor Plot
Return type:Plot
shs_control[source]¶

This attribute calculates the required Sh/S for the controllability requirement as a function of CG position.

Returns:Required Sh/S for controllability
Return type:list
shs_req[source]¶

This attribute will fit a linear spline to the controllability and stability curves to be able to address any value of Sh/S if probelems occur with the attribute ‘shs_sm’.

Returns:Required Sh/S
Return type:float
shs_sm[source]¶

This attribute will calculate the required Sh/S based on the required cg shift.

Returns:Required Sh/S
Return type:float
shs_stability[source]¶

This attribute calculates the required Sh/S for the stability requirement as a function of CG position.

Returns:Required Sh/S for stability
Return type:list
x_ac¶

Below is the current Aerodynamic Center position

x_cg¶

Below is the current COG position

x_cg_vs_mac[source]¶

This attribute returns the non dimensional distance between the COG and the wing AC.

Returns:The distance between the COG and the wing AC in meters
Return type:float
x_lemac¶

Below is the current leading edge of the MAC position

xcg_range[source]¶

This attribute is a dummy list of x_cg used for plotting Sh/S.

Returns:List of values of X_cg
Return type:list
